result.execSummary:
All charges against Rayshawn M Norwood in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rayshawn M Norwood is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rayshawn M Norwood

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rayshawn M Norwood not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Rayshawn M Norwood.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defendant in federal custody.  State moves to dismiss.  Court grants State's motion and ordered case DISMISSED.

Defendant Rayshawn M Norwood not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Rayshawn M Norwood.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. State is requesting an additional status date, defense is not objecting. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Rayshawn M Norwood not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Off the record. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Rayshawn M Norwood not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Rayshawn M Norwood not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Rayshawn M Norwood not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned to branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Rayshawn M Norwood not in court, in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Rayshawn M Norwood in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Rayshawn M Norwood in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Correctional Officer G. Kohl. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jamie J.J.-H.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Court ordered Defendant to be kept separate from alleged victim while in MCSO custody.

Defendant Rayshawn M Norwood in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Rayshawn M Norwood in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rayshawn M Norwood appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
